title: China’s Gotion launches battery production in Germany
notes:
Location:
- Gotion High Tech has launched its first production line at a former Bosch plant in Göttingen, central Germany.

Capacity:
- The current production capacity plan for the Göttingen factory is 20 GWh, expected to be completed in four phases. By mid-2024, the actual production capacity may reach 5 GWh.

Investment amounts:
- The plant is estimated to generate an annual output value of EUR 2 billion ($2.14 billion).

Project progress:
- The factory is expected to start supplying products for European customers from October. It will also serve as an R&D, logistics, and after-sales service center for Gotion's European production and operations base.

Project type:
- The project involves the conversion of a former Bosch plant into a battery production facility.

Value chain stages:
- The facility covers cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly stages.

title: Gotion High-Tech to open cell plant in Illinois in 2024
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project is located in Manteno, Illinois, USA.

Capacity:
- The planned capacity of the project is 50 GWh, with 40 GWh targeted for battery cells and 10 GWh for battery packs. The plant is expected to be ready for operations in 2024.

Investment amounts:
- Gotion High-Tech plans to invest $2 billion (€1.86 billion) to convert and equip the production facility. The company is also set to receive state subsidies of $536 million for the factory.

Project progress:
- The project is in the process of converting an existing factory into a battery production plant, with a targeted start-up in 2024. The state of Illinois has approved a property tax abatement for the plant for the next 30 years, and Gotion High-Tech is to be awarded $125 million in capital funding from the Invest in Illinois fund.

Project type:
- The project involves the conversion of an existing factory into a battery production plant.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover the stages of cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly.

Note: The information provided does not specify the current operational capacity of the project.

title: ABB to support Gotion High-Tech’s large-scale battery factories designed to serve the European and US electric vehicle markets
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Göttingen, Germany, where Gotion High-Tech's first battery manufacturing factory is situated.

Capacity:
- Information on the planned capacity or current operational capacity is not provided.

Investment amounts:
- The article mentions that Gotion High-Tech is set to open a $2 billion lithium battery plant in Illinois and is considering a factory in Morocco. However, specific investment amounts for the European project are not provided.

Project progress:
- A Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) has been signed between ABB and Gotion High-Tech to support the construction and development of large-scale lithium-ion battery factories in Europe and the US. The signing took place at Gotion High-Tech’s first battery manufacturing factory in Göttingen, Germany. A joint project team will complete a feasibility assessment to introduce ABB products and services into Gotion High-Tech, explore a research and development (R&D) collaboration, and understand how battery cells, modules, and packs from Gotion High-Tech could be supplied to ABB and its affiliates.

Project type:
- The project involves the construction and development of large-scale lithium-ion battery factories.

Value chain stages:
- The article does not specify the specific value chain stages covered at the facility.

title: Gotion is bringing a $2 billion EV battery gigafactory to Illinois, creating thousands of jobs
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Manteno, Illinois, approximately 50 miles south of Chicago.

Capacity:
- The planned capacity of the facility is to produce 10 gigawatt-hours (GWh) of lithium-ion packs and 40 GWh of li-ion cells.

Investment amounts:
- Gotion High-Tech has announced a major investment of $2 billion in the project.
- The company has received a total incentive package valued at $536 million from the state of Illinois, including $125 million in capital from the "Invest in Illinois" fund and eligibility to receive $213 million in tax benefits over the next 30 years through the REV (Reimagining Energy and Vehicles) Illinois incentive package.

Project progress:
- Gotion's decision to establish the facility in Illinois was supported by the REV Illinois incentive package and the "Invest in Illinois" fund.
- The REV agreement has been fully executed, and the project is expected to begin EV battery production in 2024.

Project type:
- The project involves the construction of a new gigafactory in Manteno, Illinois.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will focus on the production of lithium-ion cells, battery packs, and energy storage system integration, covering the stages of cell fabrication and module assembly.
